articles.title: DPRK Cabinet Gives Reception for Wrestler
articles.content:
DPRK Cabinet Gives Reception for Wrestler
Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Cabinet gave a reception at Okryu Restaurant Friday in honor of Yun Won Chol who won the title at the 2013 World Wrestling Championship.
					Present there were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Colonel General of the Korean People's Army O Kum Chol, officials concerned, sportspersons and coaches.
					
					Kim Yong Jin, speaking at the reception, said that DPRK players are now on a winning streak, a shining fruition of the wise leadership and great loving care shown by Marshal Kim Jong Un who is energetically leading the sports affairs of the country with a firm resolve to build a sports power of Juche.
					
					Yun Won Chol in his reply expressed his will to repay with loyalty the loving care and trust of Kim Jong Un by winning victory after victory at games through intensive training in the spirit of Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: Chinese Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Chinese Ambassador Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai hosted a reception at Yanggakdo International Hotel Friday on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the People's Republic of China (PRC).
					 Invited there were Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, Vice Department Director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea Kim Song Nam, Vice-Chairman of the Education Commission Jon Kuk Man, Vice-Chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Kim Jin Bom who is vice-chairman of the C.C., the DPRK-China Friendship Association, Vice-Chairman of the Joint Venture and Investment Commission Jong Jin Song and officials concerned and foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international bodies here.
					
					 Present there were a delegation of the China-Korea Friendship Association led by Chairman Wu Donghe, officials of the Chinese embassy, Chinese students and Chinese guests staying here.
					
					 Liu made a speech at the reception.
					
					 He referred to the fact that the Korean people are achieving great successes in different fields under the guidance of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by First Secretary Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The China-DPRK relations of friendship and cooperation forged by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries are boosting as the days go by, he said. 
					
					 He expressed the will to make contributions to carry forward and put the Sino-Korean friendship on a new phase in the spirit of inheritance of tradition, forward looking, good-neighborly relations and boosting of cooperation as required by the new historical time. 
					
					 Pak Ui Chun in his speech referred to the fact that the Chinese people have become masters of the state and society. They achieved development in different fields, he added.
					
					 He wished the Chinese people fresh and greater successes in their efforts to realize the "dream of China" under the leadership of the Communist Party of China with Xi Jinping as its general secretary.
					
					 He stressed that the DPRK would make positive efforts to boost the traditional DPRK-China friendship, true to the behests of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and the intentions of the top leaders of the two countries.

articles.title: Chinese Fine Art Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
Chinese Fine Art Exhibition Opens
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- A Chinese fine art exhibition opened at the Pyongyang Center for Cultural Exchange with Foreign Countries on Friday on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the friendship associations in the DPRK and China.
					 Present there were Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and vice-chairman of the C.C., the DPRK-China Friendship Association, officials concerned, Pyongyangites, the delegation of the China-Korea Friendship Association led by Chairman Wu Donghe, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai and his embassy officials.
					
					 Speeches were made at the opening ceremony.
					
					 The speakers said that the DPRK-China Friendship Association and the China-Korea Friendship Association have positively promoted the friendly exchange and cooperation as intended by the top leaders of the two countries after their formations.
					
					 They expressed the belief that the DPRK-China friendship will invariably develop thanks to the efforts of the parties, governments and peoples of the two countries. 
					
					 The participants looked round fine art pieces of China on the themes of animals and plants and natural scenery.

articles.title: Participants in Pyongyang Int'l Trade Fair Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Participants in Pyongyang Int'l Trade Fair Visit Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 9th Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on Friday.
					 They went round the historic relics at his old home in Mangyongdae where he was born and spent his childhood, nurturing his will to make revolution. They, at the same time, heard stories about it.
					
					 They also visited revolutionary sites on Mangyong Hill.
					
					 Li Nan, general manager of the Shenyang International Exhibition Corporation of the Shenyang Sub Council of China Council for the Promotion of International Trade, said:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung was the great leader of the Korean people and a close friend of the Chinese people.
					
					 He made a great contribution to the victory of the Chinese revolution.
					
					 The Chinese people will always remember his exploits.
					
					 Li Yongjian, manager of overseas business of the Beijing Purkinje General Instrument Co., Ltd., said that the President dedicated all his life to the prosperity of the country and the happiness of its people, adding that he was a great revolutionary and a peerless patriot.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Back Home
Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea led by Kil Sang Bong, vice-chairman of the union, came back home on Friday after visiting China.

articles.title: DPRK Team Beats North Mariana Islands Rival
articles.content:
DPRK Team Beats Its North Mariana Islands Rival
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The preliminaries for the 2014 Asian U-16 Soccer Championship are under way in Wuhan of China.
					 The DPRK team beat its North Mariana Islands rival 18:0 on Friday.
					
					 The DPRK team will play its last match with its Chinese rival on Sunday.

articles.title: 27th Pyongyang Int'l Invitation Table Tennis Tournament Closes
articles.content:
27th Pyongyang Int'l Invitation Table Tennis Tournament Closes
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The 27th Pyongyang International Invitation Table Tennis Tournament was closed with due ceremony at the Taekwon-Do Hall Friday.
					 Present there were Kim Pyong Sik, vice-minister of Physical Culture and Sports who is chairman of the organizing committee of the tournament, So Tong Myong, general manager of the Korean National General Insurance Company who is chairman of the DPRK Table Tennis Association, officials concerned, sportspersons and school youth and children.
					
					 Its results are as follows:

						 Second: Jong Un Ju, Ri Hyon Sim (DPRK)
						 Third: Chen Xingtong, He Zhuojia (China)
						   Kim Hye Song, Ri Mi Gyong (DPRK)

articles.title: New Stamps Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Stamps Issued in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK has recently issued four individual stamps showing Pyongyang in four seasons.
					 Depicted in the stamps are scenes of Mangyongdae covered with various flowers in spring, picturesque Rungna Islet in summer, Moran Hill tinted with red in autumn and snow-covered Ryongwang Pavilion in winter.
					
					 Korea has four seasons with their distinct features as it is located in the region of middle latitude adjoining the continent to the Pacific Ocean.

articles.title: Yun I Sang Concert Held in DPRK
articles.content:
Yun I Sang Concert Held in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The 32nd Yun I Sang Concert took place at the Yun I Sang Concert Hall here on September 24-26.
					 Put at the concert were 10 musical works composed by Yun I Sang, a noted Korean musician, and Korean musical pieces and foreign classical works.
					
					 Yun's works are consistent with love for the homeland and the nation and desire for Korea's reunification, and their performance won a great applause from the audience at the concert.
					
					 "Together for Violin and Contrabass", a work which made its debut at the concert, stresses that the north and south of Korea should pool their efforts for national unity.
					
					 "Angel in Flame", a symphonic poem created in Juche 83 (1994), represents support for the students and other patriotic young people of south Korea who rose up in resistance for democracy against fascism, as well as the patriotic desire to join the uprisers.
					
					 The impressive numbers of the concert also included "Etude for Flute Solo", "Sonatina for Twin Violins", orchestra "Muak" and "Tapis for Chordophone".
					
					 In his lifetime Yun I Sang composed 150 musical works, mostly associated with patriotism.

articles.title: Construction of Ski Resort on Masik Pass Progresses Apace
articles.content:
Construction of Ski Resort on Masik Pass Progresses Apace
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Soldier-builders are pushing forward the construction of the Ski Resort on Masik Pass.
					 Ten ski courses have been constructed in the main and nearly 60 projects of a hotel, service and lodging buildings, resting places, heating facilities and dozens of apartment houses for employees are making brisk headway.
					
					 Soldier-builders and shock brigade members are sharply increasing the speed of overall construction.
					
					 Commanding officers of the field headquarters are scrupulously organizing and commanding operations according to projects and stages after working out concrete daily plans in keeping with the pace of all projects that have reached the final stage.
					
					 Soldier-builders in charge of the ski courses are busy rounding off them.
					
					 Those in charge of the hotel and service and lodging buildings are pooling their creative wisdom to build all buildings in such a way as to match natural environment and the appearance of a world-class ski resort.
					
					 Efficient machines and equipment have been contrived and manufactured in the spirit of self-reliance to increase the speed of construction of underground parking lot, bridges and others three times as high as that in the past while saving huge manpower.
					
					 Interior plastering of a cableway control room, building for managing the ski resort, pumping station and other projects are also progressing at the final stage.
					
					 Efforts are now focused on the cableway project so that the cableway service may be available for skiers from coming winter up to Taehwa Peak more than 1 360 meters above the sea level.
					
					 Soldier-builders in charge of a reservoir transported hundreds of tons of gravel in a short span of time, creating a remarkable speed in building a dam.
					
					 The builders of a large resting place on Taehwa Peak, intermediary resting place, kindergarten, nursery, etc. are carrying out their daily quotas at more than 200 percent.
					
					 Soldier-builders are pushing forward tile pasting of dozens of apartment houses for employees and leveling of their surroundings simultaneously.
					
					 Meanwhile, shock brigade members of Kangwon Province are dynamically pressing ahead with the work to radically change the appearance of the ski resort by improving streams and creating a large area of lawn with turf of new species.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses S. Korean Regime of Cooking Up Conspiratorial Case against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses S. Korean Regime of Cooking Up Conspiratorial Case against DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- It is a trite method of the south Korean puppet regime to hatch plots against the DPRK and suppress pro-reunification patriotic figures, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article.
					 Not content with slandering the efforts made by the DPRK for dialogue, the south Korean authorities cooked up an alarming conspiratorial farce of "attempted rebellion" and deliberately linked the case with the DPRK in a bid to intensify the fascist clampdown upon the pro-reunification patriotic figures through a terror-ridden campaign for "eliminating the forces following the north", the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 This is a deliberate action to torpedo dialogue.
					
					 Recently, multi-faceted dialogue and cooperation undertakings including the working-level talks for the normalization of the operation in the Kaesong Industrial Zone took place between the north and the south.
					
					 People from various circles in south Korea have become increasingly vocal calling for more brisk dialogue and cooperation to improve the inter-Korean relations, giving momentum to their desire for achieving reunification through alliance with the north.
					
					 It was against this backdrop that the puppet Intelligence Service cooked up an alarming "attempted rebellion case" all of a sudden, kicking up a whirlwind of crackdown upon the progressive democratic forces.
					
					 Moreover, the puppet forces are kicking up a frantic conspiratorial racket against the DPRK, groundlessly talking about "disguised programme of the north's Workers' Party" and the like with the spearhead of their investigation directed to clarifying any linkage with the DPRK. This proves that the orchestrated case is nothing but a confrontation charade targeting north-south dialogue.
					
					 It is a habitual practice of the successive south Korean fascist dictators to cook up a case and stage a confrontation racket by linking it with the DPRK whenever they find themselves in a crisis.
					
					 It is widely known to the world that the puppet forces linked every "attempted rebellion case" fabricated in south Korea in the past with the DPRK. 
					
					 Typical examples were "the case of the People's Revolutionary Party (PRP)", "the case of the National Democratic Youth and Student League" and "the case of the Committee for Rebuilding the PRP" dating back to the period of "yusin" dictatorship.
					
					 The south Korean puppet group can never use those plots and fascist suppression as levers for covering up its moves for escalating the confrontation. With no excuses can it justify them.

articles.title: Halt to Moves to Introduce U.S.-made Weapons Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Halt to Moves to Introduce U.S.-made Weapons Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society, the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and other civic and public organizations of south Korea held the 138th rally for peace and disarmament on Sept. 24 demanding a halt to the moves of the puppet authorities to introduce U.S.-made weapons.
					 The organizations accused the military authorities of working hard to introduce U.S.-made fighters, adding that this is aimed to carry out the strategy for mounting a preemptive attack on the north in contingency.
					
					 They termed such moves a dangerous act of sparking off a total war on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 U.S.-made fighters which had been introduced in the past including F-15Ks are still posing a lot of problems, they charged, demanding an immediate halt to such moves as they mean wasting a stupendous amount of money collected from the people as taxes.

articles.title: S. Korean Ruling Quarters Slammed for Spoiling Atmosphere of Inter-Korean Dialogue
articles.content:
S. Korean Ruling Quarters Slammed for Spoiling Atmosphere of Inter-Korean Dialogue
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Newspapers Friday in commentaries slam the south Korean ruling quarters for letting loose a spate of invectives against the north to justify their anti-reunification acts of spoiling the atmosphere of the north-south dialogue. 
					 A few days ago, Ryu Kil Jae, puppet minister of Unification of south Korea, found fault with the north, talking about "political reason" and "unjustifiable act" before calling for "resumption of the event". Earlier, the south Korean authorities said there can never be any negotiations for reopening the tour of Mt. Kumgang resort unless the north cancels the postponement of the reunions of separated families and their relatives, and that south Korea would not make a proposal first.
					
					 This is a shameless act aimed to cover up their confrontation stand of pushing the north-south relations to a catastrophe again and shift onto the DPRK side the responsibility for the present situation by resorting to the "theory of principle", Rodong Sinmun says, and goes on:
					
					 A big hurdle now lies ahead of the way of improving the relations between the north and the south that was paved with much effort. This is attributable to the south Korean ruling quarters running amuck to realize their daydream of confrontation of social systems with no heed paid to defusing tension and reunifying the country. 
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the south Korean conservative regime found fault with the north and talked the rubbish about "attempt to hold initiative", far from acknowledging their responsibility and making an apology for it. 
					
					 Problem is their wicked and megalomaniacal way of thinking by which they approach the north-south relations from a wrong viewpoint of confrontation. 
					
					 The south Korean regime is seriously mistaken if it calculates it can get something by continuously heaping calumnies on the north. This will only result in deteriorating the north-south relations.
					
					 Such invectives can never help mend the inter-Korean relations, says Minju Joson, warning that Ryu Kil Jae will face condemnation by the nation and severe punishment by the history as "minister of confrontation".

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Accused of Threatening Teachers Union
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Accused of Threatening Teachers Union
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on September 23 carried an article denouncing the puppet regime for threatening the Teachers Union.
					 The article recalled that the Ministry of Employment and Labor threatened that it would not recognize the Teachers Union if it does not amend the present rules on recognizing the dismissed as its members.
					
					 This is an unreasonable behavior quite contrary to the international standard as it lacks any legal ground, it said, and went on:
					
					 The regime is keen to put down the legitimacy of the Teachers Union under the pretext of the issue of the dismissed because it regards the union as a thorn in its flesh.
					
					 Whenever an opportunity presented itself, the present chief executive revealed hostility toward the Teachers Union. The regime is fostering contradictions and conflict in all fabrics of society.
					
					 The article urged the regime to immediately defuse the threat to the Teachers Union.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive's Hypocrisy under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive's Hypocrisy under Fire
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- South Korean civic and public organizations are infuriated by hypocrisy of the south Korean chief executive, according to the south Korean CBS.
					 The Confederation of Trade Unions held a press conference on Wednesday at which it denounced the present chief executive for making neither apology nor clarification to the people of her behavior unilaterally reneging on her commitment to pay old-age pension made during her election campaign.
					
					 The People's Action for Properly Fixing the People's Pension made up of 11 organizations including the Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society expressed skepticism about whether the regime had a real intention to fulfill the commitment.

articles.title: Suppression of Unified Progressive Party Escalates in S. Korea
articles.content:
Suppression of Unified Progressive Party Escalates in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet regime is escalating the crackdown upon the Unified Progressive Party of south Korea under the pretext of investigating what it calls the case of the attempted rebellion.
					 The south Korean Intelligence Service (IS) searched the house and office of An So Hui, member of the Phaju City Assembly from the party, on Sept. 24.
					
					 It took such action on the charge of the violation of the "Security Law", claiming that she attended a secret meeting convened by Ri Sok Gi, lawmaker from the party, praising the north and expressing sympathy with it, and she possessed "enemy-benefiting literature."
					
					 It stormed into her house and took away her laptop, etc. as part of its search operation against members of the party on Aug. 28.
					
					 The prosecution referred to the court Hong Sun Sok, vice-chairman of the Kyonggi Provincial Committee of the party, and two others on charges of the attempted rebellion and violation of the "Security Law" concerning "praise and encouragement" on Sept. 25.
					
					 The next day it prosecuted lawmaker Ri Sok Gi at the Suwon District Court.
					
					 Such actions of the IS and the prosecution are escalating.

articles.title: Russian Paper on Issue of Korea's Reunification
articles.content:
Russian Paper on Issue of Korea's Reunification
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The 34th issue of the Russian newspaper Patriot carried an article titled "When will Korea be reunified?" 
					 The article said: 
					
					 The Korean War was the severest war incomparable with World War II ignited by fascists. The U.S. imperialists even used napalm bombs and germ weapons to brutally kill peaceable civilians. 
					
					 The U.S. is misleading the public opinion in such a manner that the Korean War had been fought between the north and the south. 
					
					 But, the U.S. egged the puppet regime of Syngman Rhee on to prepare military provocations against the northern half of Korea. 
					
					 Even now some people say that the DPRK was the first to "attack" south Korea. 
					
					 However, none of them explains the fact that a lot of leaflets calling for surrender and becoming "voluntary prisoners" were printed by a department of the U.S. for a psychological warfare, timed to coincide with the start of the war. 
					
					 The false story is still rife. 
					
					 The south Korean ruling quarters are still serving the U.S. as its stooges and yes men. In other words, they serve the U.S. imperialists who burnt away everything with napalm bombs, suffocated people with toxic gas and reduced houses and public buildings to ashes. 
					
					 The U.S. imperialists continue to commit crimes, threatening the DPRK economically and militarily. It is because the DPRK is winning victory after victory with the might of the Juche idea and Songun politics. 
					
					 The DPRK has a strong foundation of self-supporting national economy. 
					
					 Not content with dividing the homogeneous Korean nation, the U.S. imperialists are hindering its growth.
					
					 The Korean people always remember who brought misfortunes to the land of morning calm. 
					
					 They firmly believe that the day is sure to come when the U.S. imperialists are forced to withdraw from south Korea. 
					
					 Korea is sure to be reunified.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Websites by Swiss Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Websites by Swiss Organizations
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea posted leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Juche-Oriented Socialist State with Invincible Might" on their websites on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The work, made public on Sept. 5, Juche 97 (2008), says the invincibility of the DPRK lies in defending and glorifying the Juche-oriented nation-building idea and exploits of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Observed in Nigeria
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Observed in Nigeria
Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- There took place friendly meetings and film shows in Abuja City and Nasarawa and Niger States in Nigeria on Sept. 5 and 7 in celebration of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					The participants of the film shows watched Korean films such as "Pyongyang at Night" and "The Tower of the Juche Idea".
					
					Alhassan Mamman Muhammad, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said in a speech that the DPRK is a politico-ideological power which has maintained independence with its own steadfast guidelines and ideology on the basis of solid socio-political foundation.
					
					The DPRK led by Marshal Kim Jong Un identical to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il is now making a dynamic advance to emerge a power in the economy, science, technology and sports and all other fields, consolidating its position as a politico-ideological and military power, he added.
					
					A senator of the National Assembly in Nigeria praised the DPRK as an invincible socialist state.
					
					He said people have little understanding of what the DPRK is like due to the misinformation spread by the Western media.
					
					To see and hear at first hand by visiting the DPRK is to properly know about it, he recommended.
					
					The permanent secretary of the Niger State Government said the Korean people have an unshakable will to courageously advance with neither compromise nor concession in protecting their national sovereignty.
					
					That is why even the very haughty U.S. dares not provoke the Korean people strong in their will to defy death and weather any difficulty, he added.
					
					A message of greeting to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the event held in Abuja City.

articles.title: Exploits of Kim Jong Suk Lauded in Brazil
articles.content:
Exploits of Kim Jong Suk Lauded in Brazil
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Committee for Remembering Leader Kim Jong Il posted on its internet website an article titled "Brilliant life of Kim Jong Suk" on Sept. 21. 
					 The article said in its preface that 64 years have passed since Kim Jong Suk of Korea passed away. Too brief as her life was, her brilliant life is remembered by the Korean people and other progressive people, it noted. 
					
					 An article sub-titled "Life characterized by loyalty" said anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk devoted her all to protecting the safety of President Kim Il Sung, founder of socialist Korea and pioneer of the cause of global independence. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 When Korea was under the Japanese imperialists' military occupation she embarked upon the road of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle led by Kim Il Sung. She regarded it as her noble mission for the country and its people to devotedly protect him, holding him in high esteem as the destiny of Korea and the sun of the nation.
					
					 Her loyalty to him remained unchanged after the liberation of the country, too. 
					
					 She firmly upheld and thoroughly implemented the idea and line of Kim Il Sung, making a great contribution to materializing his intentions. 
					
					 Another article sub-titled "Patriotic life" said:
					
					 Her life was a genuine patriotic one. 
					
					 Born in a patriotic family, she felt the bitter pain as a member of a stateless nation. She joined in a sacred war for the liberation of the country in her teens. 
					
					 She made a contribution to the building of a new country, too. 
					
					 Her noble life dedicated to the liberation of the country and the building of a new country will shine forever along with the prosperous DPRK.

articles.title: Secretariado del CRPP condena fusilamiento de un surcoreano
articles.content:
Secretariado del CRPP condena fusilamiento de un surcoreano
Pyongyang, 27 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Hace unos dias, resulto fusilado salvajemente por el ejercito titere surcoreano un habitante cuarenton que intentaba pasar a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea cruzando a nado el rio Rimjin por su curso bajo en la ciudad de Phaju de la provincia de Kyonggi del Sur de Corea.
					Impotente de ganarse la vida en el Sur de Corea, el vagabundeaba en Japon y otros paises, pero tuvo que volver cuando fue denegada su peticion de exilio. Entonces, decidio pasar a la RPDC a riesgo de la vida.
					
					En la informacion no. 1043 publicada ayer, el Secretariado del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) califica a la camarilla titere surcoreana de bestias disfrazadas de humano y continua:
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos asesinaron cruelmente a ese habitante inocente e inerme por tratar de  buscar la salvacion.
					
					Cuando se armo un revuelo al revelarse ese hecho, ellos justifican su acto criminal diciendo que el asesinado "no acepto" la demanda de alto y "quiso fugarse".
					
					Para colmo, lo tildan de "espia norcoreano que intento cruzar al Norte" partiendo del intento de escenificar otra campana intrigante contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Por temor a las condenas internas y externas, no publican siquiera la direccion ni el nombre del fusilado.
					
					Por otra parte, los muy cinicos titeres surcoreanos acusan ahora a alguien de la supuesta "violacion de DDHH y moralidad".
					
					Las autoridades titeres deben aclarar la verdad del presente asesinato antietico y castigar severamente a los asesinos.

articles.title: Futbolistas coreanas vencen por 6:0 a sus rivales jordanas
articles.content:
Futbolistas coreanas vencen por 6:0 a sus rivales jordanas
Pyongyang, 27 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Quedaron iniciadas el dia 26 en Nanjing de China las clasificatorias del Campeonato Asiatico de Futbol sub-16 (f) de 2013.
					12 equipos se enfrentaran divididos en 4 grupos y los lideres de estas 4 zonas avanzaran a las semifinales.
					
					A la llave B pertenecen los onces de Corea, Taipei China y Jordania.
					
					En el primer partido efectuado el dia 26, la RPDC gano a Jordania por 6:0.
					
					El dia 30, tendra lugar el encuentro RPDC vs. Taipei China.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena fabricacion de complot anti-RPDC en Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena fabricacion de complot anti-RPDC en Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 27 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El complot anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea (RPDC) y la represion contra los patriotas surcoreanos partidarios de reunificacion constituyen el metodo rutinario de la banda titere surcoreana, senala asi el diario Rodong Sinmun en articulo individual divulgado el dia 27, y continua:
					Al cabo de difamar los esfuerzos de la RPDC por el dialogo, las autoridades surcoreanas orquestaron un drama sensacional llamado "incidente de conspiracion para la rebelion" y lo vincularon absurdamente con la RPDC.
					
					Bajo tal pretexto, recurren a la represion fascista contra los patriotas surcoreanos partidarios de reunificacion, calificados como "fuerzas pro-Norte".
					
					Esto es un acto que rompe intencionalmente el dialogo.
					
					Recientemente, entre ambas partes coreanas se realizaron el dialogo y otras labores de cooperacion en diversas ramas, sobre todo, las conversaciones de trabajo para la normalizacion de la Zona Industrial de Kaesong.
					
					Distintos sectores del Sur de Corea aumentaron el clima de reunificacion pro-Norte (de Corea) alzando las voces en demanda de mejoramiento de las relaciones intercoreanas mediante la activacion de dialogo y cooperacion bilaterales.
					
					En estos momentos, el Servicio Nacional de Inteligencia del Sur de Corea saco el supuesto "incidente de conspiracion para la rebelion" a fin de levantar la ola de represion contra las fuerzas progresistas y democratas.
					
					Para colmo, la camarilla surcoreana enfoca la investigacion en descubrir los supuestos "vinculos" con la RPDC y se dedica a la campana intrigante anti-RPDC hablando absurdamente del "disfrazado programa del partido del trabajo del Norte", lo cual comprueba que el presente incidente es encaminado a romper el dialogo N-S.
